name: Hong Kong
description: Hong Kong is a Special Administrative Region of China located on the southeastern coast of China, bordering Guangdong province. It’s a vibrant metropolis renowned for its stunning natural landscapes, including mountainous terrain, coastal cliffs, and lush hiking trails, juxtaposed with a dense urban environment.  A unique blend of Eastern and Western cultures, Hong Kong boasts a rich history, thriving economy, and exceptional culinary scene, making it a globally significant destination.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Hong Kong's population is a dynamic mix of ethnicities and backgrounds.
quickFacts.detail: The population density is one of the highest in the world, reflecting the city's compact urban design.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Hong Kong comprises Hong Kong Island, Kowloon, and the New Territories.
quickFacts.detail: The New Territories account for the majority of the region's landmass and are characterized by rolling hills and agricultural land.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The official currency of Hong Kong.
quickFacts.detail: HKD is pegged to the US dollar at a fixed rate of 7.80 HKD per 1 USD.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: Hong Kong is a major global financial center.
quickFacts.detail: Its economy is heavily reliant on trade, finance, and tourism.

quickFacts.label: Language
quickFacts.description: Cantonese is the dominant spoken language, while English is widely used in business and government.
quickFacts.detail: A significant portion of the population also speaks Mandarin Chinese.

climateData.title: Climate of Hong Kong
climateData.description: Hong Kong experiences a humid subtropical climate with hot, humid summers and mild, dry winters.  The city's location near the ocean moderates temperatures, but rainfall is consistent throughout the year.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The summer months are characterized by high temperatures, humidity, and frequent rainfall. Typhoons are a potential threat during this period.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn brings a welcome respite from the summer heat, with cooler temperatures, lower humidity, and less rainfall. It's a popular time for outdoor activities.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winter is mild and dry, with average temperatures ranging from 15-20°C (59-68°F).  It's a good time for exploring the city's cultural attractions.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring brings a gradual warming trend, with blossoming flowers and lush greenery. It's a beautiful time to visit Hong Kong.

naturalWonders.name: Dragon's Back
naturalWonders.description: Dragon's Back is a popular hiking trail offering stunning panoramic views of the coastline and surrounding islands. The trail follows an old military road, providing a unique glimpse into Hong Kong's history.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The trail is approximately 10 km (6.2 miles) long and takes around 2-3 hours to complete. It's relatively easy to moderate in difficulty, making it suitable for most fitness levels. The dramatic ridge line and breathtaking vistas make it a must-do for outdoor enthusiasts.

naturalWonders.name: Stanley Holiday Village
naturalWonders.description: Stanley Holiday Village is a picturesque coastal area with a vibrant market, sandy beaches, and stunning views of the South China Sea. It offers a relaxed atmosphere and a glimpse into Hong Kong's colonial past.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The village is located at the end of Stanley Peninsula, a former British military garrison. Today, it's a popular tourist destination with a bustling market selling souvenirs, handicrafts, and local delicacies. The nearby beach provides a perfect spot for swimming and sunbathing.
viewingTips: Visit the Stanley Market for souvenirs

naturalWonders.name: Hong Kong Wetland Park
naturalWonders.description: The Hong Kong Wetland Park is a haven for migratory birds and a vital wetland ecosystem. It offers a tranquil escape from the city's hustle and bustle, showcasing the beauty of nature.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park comprises three main areas: Black Point Reservoir, Koon Yuen Wetland and Lai Chi Wan Wetland. Visitors can explore the wetlands by boardwalks, boat trips, and observation towers, learning about the diverse flora and fauna that call the area home. It's a crucial habitat for numerous bird species, including migratory waders and raptors.

biodiversityCategory.name: Birds
biodiversityCategory.description: Hong Kong is a globally important site for migratory birds, attracting thousands of species each year. The city's wetlands and coastal areas provide crucial stopover points for these birds during their long journeys.

statistics.details: Approximately 500 different bird species migrate through or reside in Hong Kong annually.
Ten bird species are endemic to Hong Kong, found nowhere else in the world.

notableSpecies.name: Chinese Egret
notableSpecies.significance: A critically important species for Hong Kong's bird population.

notableSpecies.name: Black-Shouldered Kite
notableSpecies.significance: A rare raptor that relies on wetlands for foraging.

ecosystemData.title: Coastal Ecosystems of Hong Kong
ecosystemData.overview: Hong Kong's coastline is a dynamic and diverse ecosystem, encompassing rocky shores, sandy beaches, mudflats, and mangrove forests. These ecosystems provide vital habitats for a wide range of marine and terrestrial species.

biodiversityCategories.name: Marine Life
biodiversityCategories.description: The waters surrounding Hong Kong are home to a rich diversity of marine life, including coral reefs, fish, and marine mammals.

statistics.details: Coral reefs are relatively rare in Hong Kong waters due to pollution and climate change.

notableSpecies.name: Hawksbill Turtle
notableSpecies.significance: A threatened species that nests on Hong Kong's beaches.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Hong Kong
activities.description: Hong Kong offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all interests and skill levels, from challenging hikes to relaxing beach days.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Hong Kong's stunning mountain trails and enjoy breathtaking views.

activities.name: Dragon's Back Hike
activities.description: A popular hike along a former military road, offering panoramic coastal views.

activities.name: Lion Rock Hike
activities.description: A challenging hike to the summit of Lion Rock, offering stunning views of Kowloon.
activities.requirements: Hiking boots, plenty of water, snacks

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy a variety of water sports activities in Hong Kong's beautiful coastal waters.

activities.name: Kayaking
activities.description: Explore the coastline and hidden coves by kayak.

activities.name: Stand-Up Paddleboarding (SUP)
activities.description: Enjoy a relaxing paddle on the calm waters of Hong Kong's bays.

equipment.hiking: Hiking boots, trekking poles, map, compass
